items.title: The Broncos beating the Chiefs might turn out to be good news for the Colts
items.summary: If an Indianapolis Colts’ fan watched the Denver Broncos host the Kansas City Chiefs, they may have found themselves rooting for the Chiefs. That makes total sense. A loss by the Broncos would have helped the Colts maintain pace in the AFC and stay in second behind the Patriots. Although the Colts didn’t get a […]

items.title: Colts are in good position at 8-2 after bye, but must 'go out and finish our business'

As the Indianapolis Colts come out of their bye and prepare for the final seven games of the season, they’re in position to do something noteworthy. At 8-2, they’re the No. 3 seed in the AFC – New England and Denver are 9-2 – and are atop [...]

items.title: Colts return from bye week focused on Kansas City Chiefs, not previous accomplishments

items.summary: The Jaguars are now 6-4 and the Texans are 5-5; the Colts remain atop the division with an 8-2 record after the bye week.

items.title: Colts-Chiefs opening odds: Colts have another shot at statement win

The Chiefs have made many deep playoff runs and hoisted three Lombardi trophies over that time. Meanwhile, the Colts have been treading water and searching for an identity. Just like all pendulums, this […]

items.title: AFC Playoff Picture: Colts fall from first to third on Week 11 bye
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are on the bye in Week 11, and while they entered it in first place in the AFC, they have dropped not one but two slots in the playoff picture. The New England Patriots became the first nine-win team in the NFL on Thursday night, defeating the New York Jets, and taking […]

items.title: Colts’ DeForest Buckner turned to stem cell treatment to address neck injury
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – DeForest Buckner has taken a familiar approach in his attempt to return from a neck injury. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran defensive tackle posted on social media Friday that he traveled to Panama this week to receive stem cell injections as part of his treatment for a neck injury that resulted in him being [...]

items.title: AFC Playoff Picture: Colts lose top spot on their bye week
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are on the bye in Week 11, and while they entered it in first place in the AFC, they have already lost their position after one game. The New England Patriots became the first nine-win team in the NFL on Thursday night, defeating the New York Jets, and taking sole possession of […]

items.title: What’s not to love about Colts’ Tyler Warren?
items.summary: Shh…Don’t tell anyone, but Tyler Warren might be my favorite Colts player. Yes, Jonathan Taylor is stealing the headlines right now. Stealing…? Ok, not stealing, but you get the idea. All the talk is about Taylor and well deserved. He is ripping off huge runs, breaking franchise records, and carrying this team at times. The […]

Sign up here to participate in the weekly emailed surveys. Heading into Week 11, we want to know how you’re feeling after watching the team so […]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 441: Bye Week Blitz
items.summary: With the Indianapolis Colts on the bye week, the Colts Blue Zone crew takes a look at what's worked so far this season and explores some areas where the team can improve as Indy hits the home stretch. At 8-2, the Colts sit atop the AFC South and boast one of the league's top offenses. [...]

items.title: Colts’ Jonathan Taylor AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The honors keep flowing in for Jonathan Taylor. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran running back has been named AFC Offensive Player of the Week after being the catalyst for Sunday’s 31-25 overtime win over the Atlanta Falcons in Berlin. Taylor rushed 32 times for 244 yards and three touchdowns and added three receptions for [...]

items.title: Matt Taylor discusses calling Colts game in Berlin
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts came away with a thrilling 31-25 overtime win against the Atlanta Falcons. This was anything but a typical NFL matchup, as the team traveled to Germany for a "home game." Matt Taylor, radio voice of the Colts, appeared on FOX59 Morning News to discuss the unique experience of calling the Nov. 9 [...]

items.title: Colts, Kicking The Stigma encourage fans to focus on mental health during bye week
items.summary: The Colts' digital and social media channels will not publish content between Wednesday morning and Monday morning, and we encourage fans to take disconnect from devices during the bye week as well.

Item 1: At 8-2, they’re the No. 1 seed in the AFC and have created separation in the AFC South with 5-4 Jacksonville and 4-5 Houston. Item 2: Jonathan Taylor has positioned himself to be the first running [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: More context for Jonathan Taylor's 17 touchdowns, plus Tyler Warren, Daniel Jones, Zaire Franklin and special teams make key plays to push Colts to 8-2 at bye week
items.summary: The Colts' 31-25 overtime win over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday sent them into their bye week with an 8-2 record and a 2.5-game lead in the AFC South.

items.summary: With their overtime win over the Falcons on Sunday, the 8-2 Colts remain firmly in first place in the AFC South.

items.title: Colts fans from all over the world deliver remarkable atmosphere in Berlin before, during and after incredible overtime win over Falcons
items.summary: Colts fans from several continents descended upon Berlin this week to create a special environment of different cultures coming together because of one central thing: A love and passion for the Indianapolis Colts.

items.title: Jonathan Taylor nominated for Week 10 FedEx Ground Player of the Week
items.summary: Taylor recorded 286 scrimmage yards (244 rushing, 44 receiving) and three rushing touchdowns in the Colts' OT win over the Falcons.

items.title: Statement from the Indianapolis Colts
Colts’ follow record-setting Jonathan Taylor to OT win over Falcons in Berlin’s historic Olympic Stadium
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts went international. Jonathan Taylor went off. “Look,’’ said Zaire Franklin. “I’ll scream it from the mountaintops. “He’s the MVP in my book.’’ “It’s phenomenal the way he’s been running,’’ added Shane Steichen. In the NFL’s first game at Berlin’s historic Olympic Stadium on Sunday, Taylor’s brilliance carried the Colts when [...]

items.title: Sauce Gardner makes immediate impact in Colts debut
items.summary: Gardner just met his new teammates and coaches on Wednesday, but already fit in seamlessly as he helped the Colts secure an overtime win over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday.

items.title: Jonathan Taylor takes historic season to international stage with 3-touchdown, record-breaking, walk-off performance vs. Falcons
items.summary: Taylor rushed for 244 yards and three touchdowns in the Colts' 31-25 win over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday at Olympic Stadium in Berlin.

items.title: Taylor's touchdown in overtime propels Colts over Falcons in Berlin
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Jonathan Taylor scored an eight-yard touchdown in overtime to lift the Indianapolis Colts to a 31-25 win over the Atlanta Falcons at the Olympic Stadium in Berlin on Sunday. Taylor had a monster day on the ground, gaining 244 yards and scoring three touchdowns as the Colts are now 8-2 and in the [...]

items.title: Jonathan Taylor's historic game fuels Colts' thrilling OT win vs. Falcons
items.summary: Taylor rushed for three touchdowns – including an 83-yarder in the fourth quarter and the game-winner in overtime – to set a new franchise record and propel the Colts to victory.

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor scores 65th career rushing touchdown to set new franchise record
items.summary: By scoring two rushing touchdowns on Sunday against the Atlanta Falcons, Taylor passed Pro Football Hall of Famer Edgerrin James to set a franchise record with 65 career rushing touchdowns.

items.title: Colts vs. Falcons in Berlin: What to watch for
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Areas of interest in the Indianapolis Colts’ Sunday meeting with the Atlanta Falcons at Olympic Stadium in Berlin, Germany. items.title: Colts’ Reggie Wayne on Adonai Mitchell: I think AD was on track
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The business side of the NFL delivered a gut-punch to Adonai Mitchell and one of his staunchest supporters. “It sucks,’’ Reggie Wayne said Thursday. The Indianapolis Colts so coveted Sauce Gardner leading up to Tuesday’s trade deadline that they agreed to send the New York Jets two first-round draft picks for their All-Pro [...]
